intro: Equilabium pinetorum, commonly known as the pine forest bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the temperate forests of North America. It is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments under the canopy of pine trees. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery down. Equilabium pinetorum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in forest ecosystems.
